column1: The name of the public class must exactly match the name of the file it is in, considering Java's case sensitivity.
The name of the public class does not need to match the name of the file it is in.
Java requires that you compile your source code into bytecode before you can run it.
Java allows you to run your source code directly without compiling it into bytecode.
After compiling, you run your Java program with the 'java' command followed by the class name without the .class extension.
After compiling, you run your Java program with the 'javac' command followed by the class name with the .class extension.
The 'assignGuest' method in the Room class assigns a guest to the room.
The 'vacateRoom' method in the Room class assigns a guest to the room.
The 'displayRoomDetails' method in the Room class prints out the room's details, including room number, type, occupancy status, and nightly rate.
The 'displayRoomDetails' method in the Room class only prints out the room number and type.
Java arrays are fixed in size and their capacity cannot be altered once created.
Java arrays are dynamic in size and their capacity can be altered after creation.
Java ArrayLists offer a dynamic array that can grow and shrink as needed.
Java ArrayLists have a fixed size that cannot be changed after initialization.
The 'add' method is used to add elements to an ArrayList.
The 'append' method is used to add elements to an ArrayList.
The 'remove' method is used to remove elements from an ArrayList.
The 'delete' method is used to remove elements from an ArrayList.
In a UML class diagram, classes are depicted as rectangles divided into three parts: class name, attributes, and methods.
In a UML class diagram, classes are depicted as circles divided into two parts: class name and attributes.
In a UML class diagram, a plain line connecting two classes indicates an association between them.
In a UML class diagram, a dotted line connecting two classes indicates an association between them.
In a UML class diagram, the '+' symbol before an attribute or method indicates that it is public.
In a UML class diagram, the '-' symbol before an attribute or method indicates that it is public.
